title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in MPhil Medical Imaging
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.
outcome: The Master’s degree graduates are expected to have acquired advanced knowledge in major areas of an academic discipline while maintaining a broad understanding of other related fields. Masters’ degree graduates should have gained enough background knowledge to enable them to perform research with minimal supervision. In particular, they should have the ability to formulate individual research tasks and to develop solution methodologies under minimal supervision. Master’s degree graduates should be capable of producing original, innovative research output, some of which may lead to publication in well-respected scholastic venues. They should have gained proficiency in techniques of knowledge dissemination through presentation and writing.

instructors:
Professor Ann Dorothy KING, 

Professor CHEN Weitian, 

Professor CHU Chiu Wing Winnie, 

Professor HUI Sai Kam, 

Professor James Francis GRIFFITH, 

Professor Neeraj Ramesh MAHBOOBANI, 

Professor SO Tiffany Yuen Tung, 

Professor WANG Yixiang

Professor CHU Chiu Wing Winnie, 

Professor HUI Sai Kam, 

Professor James Francis GRIFFITH, 

Professor Neeraj Ramesh MAHBOOBANI, 

Professor SO Tiffany Yuen Tung, 

Professor WANG Yixiang

title: Seminar
requirements: For students in MPhil Medical Imaging
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work on the assigned research topic.
outcome: The Master’s degree graduates are expected to have acquired advanced knowledge in major areas of an academic discipline while maintaining a broad understanding of other related fields. Masters’ degree graduates should have gained enough background knowledge to enable them to perform research with minimal supervision. In particular, they should have the ability to formulate individual research tasks and to develop solution methodologies under minimal supervision. Master’s degree graduates should be capable of producing original, innovative research output, some of which may lead to publication in well-respected scholastic venues. They should have gained proficiency in techniques of knowledge dissemination through presentation and writing.

title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in PhD Medical Imaging
description: To attend seminar/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving design and data analysis.
outcome: The Ph.D. graduates are expected to acquire in-depth knowledge in the field and be capable of performing independent research with global standards. In particular, the Ph.D. students should have the ability to identify research trends and opportunities venture into new research areas when appropriate, define long-term research objectives, formulate original research problems, and originate and develop solution methodologies. The students should be able of producing research output at a level that can either lead to publications in high-ranking scholastic venues, or to novel applications in relevant industrial, commercial, or other public sectors, or to other forms of useful knowledge transfer to society.
